intro: Adenocline pauciflora var. rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed adenocline, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant's leaves are typically rounded and have a smooth texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and plant conservationists.
